text: Michael McGrath (born 7 April 1936) is an Irish former professional footballer. He was a left half and began his career with Dublin club Home Farm before moving to England to join Blackburn Rovers in August 1954. He made 269 Football League appearances over the next ten years at Ewood Park. and played with players including Peter Dobing, Derek Dougan and Mike England. He helped the club win promotion to the First Division and appeared in the 1960 FA Cup Final where he scored an own goal in a 3–0 defeat to Wolves. In March 1966 he signed for Bradford Park Avenue where he made 50 league appearances before becoming player manager at Bangor City F.C.. He also played 22 times for the Republic of Ireland national football team and made one appearance for the Republic of Ireland B team in 1957. He now lives in Blackburn and has retired after 24 years working for Thwaites Brewery. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:People from Dublin (city) Category:Republic of Ireland association footballers Category:Republic of Ireland international footballers Category:Republic of Ireland B international footballers Category:Home Farm F.C. players Category:Blackburn Rovers F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Republic of Ireland football managers Category:Bangor City F.C. managers Category:Association footballers not categorized by position Category:Bradford (Park Avenue) A.F.C. players Category:Bangor City F.C. players
title: Mick McGrath (footballer)
